'''Drilbur''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''モグリュー''' ''Mogurew'') is a {{type|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Excadrill}} starting at [[level]] 31.

==Biology==
Drilbur has a short, wide body with two small, ovoid feet with three toes each. Its body is mostly black, but has a jagged, navy blue stripe that runs diagonally around its torso from its left shoulder. It is connected at the bottom to another stripe, which extends around the base of its torso. It has a white face with a long snout, tipped by its pink nose. Its eyes are at the base of its nose on either side. Drilbur's arms are wide and thin with a blue spot on its palms. It lacks traditional hands, as its arms form directly into its three, extremely large claws. It has a very small, stubby tail.

Drilbur can straighten its body and align its claws forward, allowing it to spin like a drill and dig through the ground. It is able to dig at speeds of up to 30&nbsp;mph (50&nbsp;km/h). As seen in both [[PS481|the manga]] and [[BW100|the anime]], Drilbur has no issues being around humans, and can be very friendly.

==In the anime==
[[File:Iris Drilbur.png|250px|thumb|left|Drilbur in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Iris's Excadrill|Iris's Drilbur]]====
Drilbur debuted in ''[[BW033|Iris and Excadrill Against the Dragon Buster!]]'' in a series of flashbacks, as the Pokémon that would become [[Iris's Excadrill]].

====Other====
A Drilbur appeared in [[PK22]] alongside {{p|Darumaka}} and {{p|Gothita}}, in which it was angry at {{AP|Oshawott}} and {{AP|Tepig}}, who had eaten the apples that the three had collected.

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[BW075|A Restoration Confrontation! Part 1]]'', under the ownership of [[Ferris]]. It was used to help Ferris look for [[Fossil]]s inside [[Twist Mountain]].

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[BW099|A Surface to Air Tag Battle Team!]]'', under the ownership of [[Soren and Rocko|Rocko]]. It battled alongside Rocko's twin brother [[Soren and Rocko|Soren]]'s {{p|Braviary}} against [[Ash's Unfezant]] and [[Cilan's Pansage]], and lost.

===Minor appearances===
A Drilbur appeared in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[BW081|Crisis at Ferroseed Research!]]''.

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[BW136|A Pokémon of a Different Color!]].''

A Drilbur appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'' as one of the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Drilbur Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Drilbur in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Trainer's Drilbur appeared in ''[[PS466|An Odd Speech]]''.

In ''[[PS481|Sandstorm]]'', a Drilbur partakes in a game that the {{tc|worker}}s play in during their break.

===In the Pokémon + Nobunaga's Ambition ~ Ranse's Color Picture Scroll ~ manga===
A Drilbur appears in the manga adaptation of Pokémon Conquest.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Drilbur makes an appearance in {{OBP|Pocket Monsters BW|Kosaku Anakubo}}.

===In the Pokémon RéBURST manga===
A Drilbur appears in ''[[RB01|The Beginning of the Adventure!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Drilbur was revealed on [[Oha Suta]] on June 27, 2010.
* Drilbur shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Diglett}} and {{p|Dugtrio}}. They are all known as the Mole Pokémon.

===Origin===
It is based on a {{wp|Mole (animal)|mole}}. The shape of its arms could come from shovels, and its claws from the teeth of {{wp|Burr (cutter)|burrs}}.

====Name origin====
Drilbur might be a combination of ''drill'' and ''burrow'' or ''{{wp|Burr (cutter)|burr}}''.

Mogurew may be a combination of 土竜 ''mogura'' (mole) and {{wp|screw}}.
